_header: Honoured be Thou blissful heaven Queen
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘The Angels’ Song’, in the English translation of the Pèlerinage de l’âme — two stanzas rhyme royal

Bod770.First Lines:
HEried be þou blisful heuen queneand worschepid mot þou
                    be in euery place…
Bod770.Last Lines:
…ffor þyn estate ImperialNo praising is þat may be
                    peregal

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Honowred be þowe blestefull heuen queen& worschipyd motte
                    þowe be in euery place…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…ffor vn to þyne asstaate ymperiallNo preysynge ys
                    þat may be peregall

CamGon124.First Lines:
honoured be þu blysful heuen quene& worschipid mot þu
                    be in eueri place…
CamGon124.Last Lines:
…for to þyn estate ImperialNo preysyng is þat may be
                    paregal

CULKk17.First Lines:
Honourid be þou blysful heuene qweneAnd worchepid mote
                    þou ben euery place…
CULKk17.Last Lines:
ffor vn to þin estat ImperyalNo preysing is þat may be
                    paregal
CULKk17.Attributed Title:
her endith þe drem of þe pilgrimage of þe soule (f.
                        124v)

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
honoured be þou blistefull heuen queneand worscheped mote
                    þou be in euery place…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…ffor vnto þi estate ImperiallNo presunge is þat may
                    be eugale

BLEge615.First Lines: HOnured be thu blisful heuene queenAnd worschepid mot þu be in eueri place…
BLEge615.Last Lines: …ffor vnto thin astate imperiallTo praisyng is þat may be peregall
BLEge615.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             “Hoccleve’s Works: The Regement of Princes and fourteen minor
                poems.” 
             EETS
         e.s. 72 (1897); repr. 1988: xlvii-xlviii.

NYPLSpenc19.First Lines:
Honoured be þu blisful heuene queneAnd worshiped mote þu
                    ben in euery place…
NYPLSpenc19.Last Lines:
ffor vnto thyn estate imperialeNo praisyng is that may be
                    paragale
